newsitem.title: ITALY: Fininvest, IBM form outsourcing joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Fininvest, IBM form outsourcing joint venture.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp and Silvio Berlusconi's Fininvest SpA media group said on Friday they were setting up a joint outsourcing company.

Officials from the two groups told a news conference the new company, called ICP Servizi, to be 20 percent owned by Fininvest with IBM holding the rest, was expected to have a turnover of "150 billion lire ($86 million) in six years".
The new outsourcing company will provide Fininvest with computerised management and data processing services which up to now Fininvest itself has supplied.
The two groups are also studying other possible areas of cooperation such as in asset management and network computing.

Fininvest chairman Fedele Confalonieri and Bill Etherington, IBM general manager for Europe, Africa and the Middle East, said that under the accord IBM would make available to Fininvest its own research centres worldwide.
The new outsourcing company will start operating in October. ($ = 1743 Italian Lire)
